title: Digital and print advertising revenue of U.S. newspapers 2003 to 2014
summary: Overall Print is gradually decreasing, Digital is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The order of lines according to average values of Revenue in billion U.S. dollars, in descending order is: 1. Print, and lastly, 2. Digital.
Digital reported the lowest Revenue in billion U.S. dollars about 2.74 in Year 2009
The difference of Revenue in billion U.S. dollars between Print and Digital is smaller at Year 2010 compared to the Year 2007.
min_summary: Overall Print is gradually decreasing, Digital is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
mid_summary: Overall Print is gradually decreasing, Digital is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
max_summary: Overall Print is gradually decreasing, Digital is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
Digital reported the lowest Revenue in billion U.S. dollars about 2.74 in Year 2009
The greatest difference of Revenue in billion U.S. dollars between Print and Digital occurs at Year 2007 and the smallest difference occurs at 2010.
